intro: Bridelia scleroneura, commonly known as the rough-leaved bridelia, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, oblong leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid to moist environments. Bridelia scleroneura is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional herbal practices.
